page.title: 01GOOSTREY-GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Goostrey is a village of about 2000 inhabitants.It is surrounded by the flat farmlands of the Cheshire Plain. Settlement in the area is mostly in the village with farms occurring at intervals along the minor roads.There is a small settlement at Jodrell Bank close to the radio telescope.The huge bowl of the telescope can be seen for miles around. Goostrey has a church,a chapel,two public houses,a village hall,a school and a few shops.Many of the villagers are relative newcomers who have moved into houses built in the last fifteen years.In spite of this influx, the village still retains its rural customs such as the Gooseberry Show and the Rose Day.
